intro: Eucryphia × nymansensis, commonly known as the Nymans eucryphia, is a hybrid shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its ornamental, fuzzy, silver-green foliage. The plant produces clusters of pale yellow to orange-red flowers in spring, which are borne on long, slender pedicels. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. Due to its unique appearance and seasonal bloom, it is often used in ornamental horticulture.
